summary: Recognized a woman's constitutional right to privacy in deciding whether to have an abortion, subject to certain limitations.
holding: The Due Process Clause of the 14th Amendment provides a fundamental right to privacy that protects a woman's choice to have an abortion, with state regulation allowed under certain circumstances.
significance: Landmark decision on reproductive rights that established a constitutional framework for abortion regulation (later overturned by Dobbs v. Jackson in 2022).
